title: So I died 25 mins in game
body:
which currently allows me to browse reddit, see the patch notes, read them all, laugh at Riot lowering death timers in the 30-55 min mark like that will totally fix the games pacing problems and make this post about it

hey look im still dead

replies.body:
look on the bright side

you can go make yourself a sandwich without getting reported for afk
This is the only thing that truly matters
Bitch, please. I'm eating ribs.
#savage
A sandwich? I once made Ramen in the time it took me to get back to the game.
Ramen? I once prepared Thanksgiving dinner and I was still dead when I came back to the game.

Thanksgiving dinner? Bro, I went on vacation to a different country, had lunch with a foreign friend, flew back and I had to reconnect because of Leaverbuster. Even then there was still a death timer.
Was that a 5 for 4 exchange, with only the support left? Because that's the only way the towers could stand that long.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
or totally take a dunk and then shave after
Look on the other bright side...atlest you get to respawn, if it was a Morgana Q you would get a leave buster.
I enjoy getting a solo kill on someone as Nasus at 18 mins and then reaching their inhib turret by the time they respawn.
{{champion:222}}  wanna race, Nasus?
{{champion:2}} - I'll have you know I took out the nexus in twisted treeline in 6 minutes alone.... against 3 bots.....
{{champion:23}} I want to race, bitch.
Nothing compares to that death that lasts so long your enemy team wrecks your entire base and wins despite the fact that up to this point you were winning but got unlucky just once XD
Oh yes, have a lead throughout the whole game, turret lead, gold lead, no way for things to go wrong, then you get aced once and IMMEDIATELY lose. Happens way too often during longer games.

To be fair, if you had that big a lead, you probably could and should have finished the game a long time ago.

It reminds me of those ARAMs where people don't finish intentionally and prefer butchering people on spawn. Just once in a while they screw up and it costs them the entire game.

You can have a big lead and still not get an ace because they play super safe and just clear waves when with men down. If there's noone to defend though, the towers melt ridiculously fast, and the death timers are long enough to end.

That can happen, but it's probably also possible to make a more risky play by either having someone tank turret and melt it down or engaging on the enemy beneath their turret.
If you are far ahead you should win that fight.

Another possibility would include heavy splitpushing, which almost always gives an opening at some point.
Or try and force fights at Baron, Dragon etc.

I know that it isn't easy and I have plenty of games too in which my team just doesn't manage to finish. But that is usually to mediocre decision making and not because there is a truly impossible situation.

This scenario has come to pass too often:

Your mid lane has inhibitor, inhibitor turret, inner turret and outer turret and two turrets at Nexus. Their mid lane has nothing aside from a turret at Nexus.

They win a teamfight.

They also win the game because they pushed down everything in mid.

It's better than nothing. This is the first pacing change they have made since the start of this season, at least they acknowledge the problem and will hopefully do more in the next few patches.

~~And i'm certainly not praying for them to fix this game before I quit because i'm buying that Elise skin day one~~
Same here man. I really want that new Elise skin too :D
Yeah I agree, why punish people for mistakes? Why not let games go 70+ minutes every time? Stupid rito.
70 minute games with reasonable death timers are better than 20 minute games with retarded death timers. at least in the 70 minute game all ten people got to play league of legends.
I died and had time to read this, google up the patch notes, read them, make a reddit account, refer to this post on my reddit post, and make 3 memes. Hold on, my timer is halfway done.

it sucks though i had a game were i didnt die for the longest time then i died once and got stuck with a 1min + deathtimer....
we basically lost the game cuz my team had no tank to speak of ( I was dead) they pushed 2 towers got an inhib and a dragon.... 

1 fukkin death got them that
lololol i agree
{{item:3026}} Will solve all this for you.

>
> {{item:3026}} Will solve all this for you.

then die as you respawn with 3 people around you because you didn't get a kill your team lost the teamfight
At 25 minutes? 1st or 2nd item at best? Well... ok then

> [{quoted}](name=Sariat1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2Uo5hnye,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-04-05T19:29:03.858+0000)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_pdpYYj2-5Y](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_pdpYYj2-5Y)
That was... absolutely... fantastic
Hey, at least morg didn't bind you in the fountain when you respaw...crap
I think your exaggurating
He really isn't I have time in between death to read a chapter of manga {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I got to wack off to jen setler and bust at the last second, imma say worth, rito pls no nerf.
It should've been 20-55m imo but oh well.

> [{quoted}](name=Frozen Sovereign,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=2Uo5hnye,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2016-04-05T21:25:02.571+0000)
>
> It should've been 20-55m imo but oh well.

i think they just want to give us a reason to use death timer runes.

-15% time spent dead sounds really attractive right now.
In a game where matches average 30-35 minutes how is 30-55 minutes "mid-game"?  That's what I want to know.

reduced death timers at 30-55 min http://media.lolusercontent.com/api/embedly/1/image/resize?url=http%3A%2F%2Fi.imgur.com%2FfmqYV53.png%5B%2Fimg%5D&key=a45e967db0914c7fb472fd4381e6c85b&width=425 http://media.lolusercontent.com/api/embedly/1/image/resize?url=http%3A%2F%2Fi.imgur.com%2FMswLApl.png%5B%2Fimg%5D&key=a45e967db0914c7fb472fd4381e6c85b&width=425

For all the people complaining that its possible to lose after getting aced once at 35 minutes in game with a huge lead and losing. Yes, it's called a throw. The death timers are there to make it so that it is always possible to win for a losing team. It adds a lot of strategy to the game. Even if you are winning, you cant let down your guard down for a second otherwise the enemy will capitalist on it. Happens in real life battles all the time. But I guess now-a-days kids want games to be easy.
You were unlucky, if you were hit by {{champion:25}}  root you would have had the time to watch the entire Lost series again
Just a bit too short for my 5 course meal.
And I was here thinking that 6.7 was gonna fix the death timer...  Rito why do you like to kill dreams?
Just make yourself a sandvich, get comfy, open a movie or 2 and when your finishedm you just respawned!
I thought this was going to end with your nexus exploding.

Legit, these death timers are ridiculous.
Even if you only get your first death 20 minutes in, you have to wait 30+ seconds to come back in.
That doesn't sound like a lot, but that leaves the enemy enough time to take 2 towers and either drag or baron. :/

Next patch note:

LoL client will now exit if Alt-Tab.

Solve ya problem.
